com.stephengware.java.games.mm_game.state

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stephengware.java.games.mm_game.state.State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the current state of a Tic Tac Toe game.
    Author:
    Stephen G. Ware

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Player current
      The player who will move next
      private Player[][] grid
      The 9 square grid
      private Player winner
      The player who has won (if any)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
        State()
      Constructs the initial state of all Tic Tac Toe games, in which the grid is empty and it is X's turn to move.
      private State(State previous, Move move)
      Constructs the new state that would result from taking a given Move in some given previous state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        private State(State previous,
              Move move)
        Constructs the new state that would result from taking a given Move in some given previous state.
        Parameters:
        previous - the state of the game before the given move is taken
        move - the move to be taken

      • State

        public State()
        Constructs the initial state of all Tic Tac Toe games, in which the grid is empty and it is X's turn to move.

    • Method Detail

      • checkWin

        private final boolean checkWin(Player player)
        Checks if a given player has won.
        Parameters:
        player - the candidate player
        Returns:
        true if the player has won, false otherwise

      • checkRow

        private final boolean checkRow(int row,
                               Player player)
        Checks if a given player has placed 3 marks on the given row.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the grid to check
        player - the player
        Returns:
        true if the player has placed 3 marks on that row

      • checkColumn

        private final boolean checkColumn(int column,
                                  Player player)
        Checks if a given player has placed 3 marks on the given column.
        Parameters:
        column - the column of the grid to check
        player - the player
        Returns:
        true if the player has placed 3 marks on that column

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns the player whose turn it is to move next.
        Returns:
        the current player

      • getSquare

        public Player getSquare(int row,
                        int column)
        Returns the mark at the given row and column of the grid.
        Parameters:
        row - the row number (0 to 2)
        column - the column number (0 to 2)
        Returns:
        the player who has placed a mark at that location, or null if no player has placed a mark in that location

      • getAvailableMoves

        public java.lang.Iterable<Move> getAvailableMoves()
        Returns a set of all the next moves that can be made in the game.
        Returns:
        all possible next moves

      • transition

        public State transition(Move move)
        Returns the state that would result from taking the given move. Note that this object remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to take
        Returns:
        the resulting state

      • isTerminal

        public boolean isTerminal()
        Returns true if a winner has been decided or if the game is a tie.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise

      • getWinner

        public Player getWinner()
        Returns the winner, if one has been determined.
        Returns:
        the winning player, or null if no player has won or the game ended in a tie
